API Reference¶

scrape.py¶

class scrape.GradCafeScraper¶

Scraper for The Grad Cafe applicant data

fetch_page(url)¶

Fetch HTML content from URL using urllib3

parse_detail_page(html, applicant)¶

Extract detailed info from individual result page

parse_list_page(html)¶

Extract result IDs and basic info from list page

pull_data(max_seconds=10)¶

Scrape list pages starting from page 1 for up to max_seconds.

save_data(applicant_list)¶

Append applicant data to JSON file

scrape_page(page_num)¶

Scrape a single page (list + all detail pages)

clean.py¶

Load and clean applicant data using the LLM cleaning script.

clean.clean_data(input_file=None, llm_script_path='../llm_hosting/app.py', output_file=None)¶

Clean applicant data using LLM by calling external Python script

clean.load_data(file_path=None)¶

Load applicant data from JSON file

load_data.py¶

load_data.bulk_insert_with_skip_duplicates(conn, records)¶

Bulk insert data with ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING

load_data.create_table_if_not_exists(conn)¶

Create the applicant table if it doesn’t exist

load_data.load_jsonl_data(filepath)¶

Load and parse JSONL file with correct field mapping

load_data.main()¶

Main function to load data from JSONL to PostgreSQL

load_data.parse_date(date_string)¶

Parse date string like ‘January 31, 2026’ to date object

load_data.parse_float(value)¶

Extract first numeric value from mixed strings (e.g., ‘GPA 3.89’).

query_data.py¶

query_data.main()¶

flask_app.py (routes)¶

Flask app entrypoint and route overview.

Routes: - GET / -> redirect to /analysis - GET /analysis -> render analysis page - POST /pull-data -> start the scraper subprocess - GET /pull-status -> report whether a pull is running - POST /update-analysis -> refresh analysis results

flask_app.create_app(question_map=None, connect_fn=None, db_kwargs_fn=None, start_pull_fn=None)¶
